question_text:
This problem is related to a typical big-endian 8-bit CPU with a 16-bit accumulator (abbreviated as A). (15%)

Give a general algorithm to show how the CPU sets overflow and carry flags during performing addition. (5%)
answer: 請按照仲裁結果填入簡要答案
detail-answer: 請按照仲裁結果填入詳細答案
key-points: 按照主代理人提供的關鍵點填寫
difficulty level: 按照仲裁結果填寫難度等級只能填入簡單、中等 或 困難
error reason: 若主代理人與次代理人有「衝突或不同意見」，請填入簡短說明，否則留空字串

group_question_text: Answer the following questions regarding process management.

sub_questions.question_text:
(16%)

1.Please indicate whether each of the following statements is true or false. If a statement is incorrect, please explain the reasons. 

(1) Multithreaded programs can always provide better performance than a single-threaded solution. (2%)

(16%)

1.Please indicate whether each of the following statements is true or false. If a statement is incorrect, please explain the reasons. 
 
(2) A program can always run faster in a multicore system than in a single-core system. (2%)

(16%)

1.Please indicate whether each of the following statements is true or false. If a statement is incorrect, please explain the reasons. 

(3) A multithreaded program using multiple user-level threads achieves better performance on a multiprocessor system than on a single-processor system. (2%)

question_text:
Consider the following set of processes, with the length of the CPU burst given in milliseconds:

2.The processes are assumed to have arrived at the ready queue in the order P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, all at time 0. Answer the questions using the following scheduling algorithms: shortest-job-first (SJF), and round-robin (RR, with quantum=2).

(1) What is the waiting time of each process for each of the scheduling algorithms? (5%)
